section: This Services Agreement (this "Agreement") is entered into on October 1, 2019 and is made effective as of November 1, 2019 (the "Effective Date")
explanation: The agreement states it is entered into on October 1, 2019, but then specifies an Effective Date of November 1, 2019. This creates ambiguity. It is unclear what actions, if any, are considered valid and binding between October 1 and November 1. This discrepancy affects the parties' rights and obligations during that interim period.

section: This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement and shall terminate on December 31, 2020, unless terminated earlier in accordance with Section 3.2.
explanation: The language 'This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement' is a structural flaw and is not properly written. It doesn't fit into the sentence and it affects the meaning. This can cause potential disputes regarding the actual start date of the contract and its duration. It needs to be edited to read clearly.

section: The Parties hereby irrevocably submit any disputes under this Agreement to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts located in Tel-Aviv, Israel, provided however, that Recipient shall be entitled to seek an injunction or other appropriate remedy against Provider in the country in which Provider has acted in breach of the terms hereof.
explanation: While specifying Tel-Aviv, Israel as the exclusive jurisdiction, it also allows the Recipient to seek injunctive relief in the Provider's country. This can create confusion. It's unclear if seeking an injunction elsewhere affects the 'exclusive jurisdiction' clause. Does a dispute resolution process have to start in Israel, even for an injunction sought elsewhere? This needs clarification to ensure consistent dispute resolution.
